TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {1261=The Automotive Restoration Technology curriculum is designed to provide individuals with the competencies needed to work in the automotive restoration industry. The coursework includes research and application of information on specific components of a wide range of classic vehicles (1900 - 1970), such as internal combustion engines, transmissions, brakes, sheet metal, upholstery, starters, generators, and related systems. Graduates of the curriculum should qualify for entry-level employment opportunities in the automotive restoration industry.}

textBeforeTable: A. General Education Courses (6 SHC) Course Requirements for Automotive Restoration Technology Diploma Program Site: Lee Campus - Day Program Career Pathway Option: Diploma in Automotive Restoration Technology Program Length: 3 semesters Academic Standards: See General Academic Standards. Entrance Standards: See General Admission Standards. The Automotive Restoration Technology curriculum is designed to provide individuals with the competencies needed to work in the automotive restoration industry. The coursework includes research and application of information on specific components of a wide range of classic vehicles (1900 - 1970), such as internal combustion engines, transmissions, brakes, sheet metal, upholstery, starters, generators, and related systems. Graduates of the curriculum should qualify for entry-level employment opportunities in the automotive restoration industry. Automotive Restoration Technology Credential: Diploma in Automotive Restoration Technology D60140 Transport Systems Technologies College Catalog 2008-2010 Table of Contents Money for College College Services Distance Education Continuing Education Programs of Study Admissions --> Webadvisor GroupWise Business Office Intranet Faculty & Staff Transcript Request Give to CCCC Alumni & Friends Webadvisor
